updated_cases.title: Verify vpop IP is used and DEIP policy is matched
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Configure 'tenant_footprint.json' with multple footprint
- Create DEIP policy with "egress_ip_type": shared
- Route traffic and check vpop ip is used
- Verify the DEIP policy match using logs
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- DEIP policy is matched
- VPOP IP is used for traffic
- Review appmodule 3 logs to see so_mark picked 
- Review policy 1 logs, to see EgressIP policy being picked indicated by ns_policy_apply_egress_ip_policy()

updated_cases.title: Verify DEIP policy is matched but DEIP is not used since footprint_id is not present in json
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create DEIP with footprint id not present in tenant_footprint.json
- Send traffic to match the policy
- check that DEIP is not used since footprint id is not present
- VPOP IP or regular ip is used based on vpop enablement
updated_cases.custom_expected:
DEIP should not be used
VPOP or DE IP is used based on the vpop status

updated_cases.title: Verify invalid footprint_id in DEIP policy
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create DEIP with invalid footprint id with string
- Verify policy creation shouldnot through error

updated_cases.title: Verify invalid egress_ip_type in DEIP policy
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create DEIP policy with invalid egress_ip_type (except: dedicated/shared)
- Check policy creation should fail

updated_cases.title: Verify DEIP policy match for one source AND destination with dedicated and shared egress type
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create DEIP policy with one Source AND one Destination
Src: User: bkodirangaiah@netskope.com
Dst: Domain==ifconfig.me
egress_ip_profile: 
          egress_ip_type:Dedicated/Shared
          footprint : 12345
- Send traffic to match the policy
- Check that the policy is matched, and ensure that the corresponding IPs are used and that logs are generated.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- DEIP policy is matched
- DE/VPOP IP is used for traffic
- Review appmodule 3 logs to see so_mark picked 
- Review policy 1 logs, to see EgressIP policy being picked indicated by ns_policy_apply_egress_ip_policy()

updated_cases.title: Verify DEIP policy match with exclusion in Source and Destination field with egress_ip_type shared
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create DEIP policy with exclusion in Source AND Destination
Src: User: exclude: bk-test01@netskope.com
       Source IP User: exclude: 2.2.2.2
Dst: App==Box
       Des IP: exclude: 10.10.10.1
egress_ip_profile: 
          egress_ip_type:Dedicated/Shared
          footprint : 12345
- Send traffic to match the policy
- Check that the policy is matched, and ensure that the corresponding IPs are used and that logs are generated.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- DEIP policy is matched
- DE/VPOP IP is used for traffic
- Review appmodule 3 logs to see so_mark picked 
- Review policy 1 logs, to see EgressIP policy being picked indicated by ns_policy_apply_egress_ip_policy()

updated_cases.title: Verify DEIP policy match for multiple source AND destination with dedicated and shared egress type
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create DEIP policy with Source AND Destination
Src: User: bk-test01@netskope.com
        Src IP Egress: 1.1.1.1
Dst: App==Box
        Cat==Cloud
        Domain==*.box.com
        Dest IP==10.1.1.1 (DoesNotMatch)
egress_ip_profile: 
          egress_ip_type:Dedicated/Shared
          footprint : 12345
- Send traffic to match the policy
- Check that the policy is matched, and ensure that the corresponding IPs are used and that logs are generated.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- DEIP policy is matched
- DE/VPOP IP is used for traffic
- Review appmodule 3 logs to see so_mark picked 
- Review policy 1 logs, to see EgressIP policy being picked indicated by ns_policy_apply_egress_ip_policy()

updated_cases.title: Verify sending traffic without matching the policy shouldn't see dedicated/shared egress IP
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create DEIP policy with Source AND Destination
Src: User: bkodirangaiah@netskope.com
Dst: Domain==config.me
egress_ip_profile: 
      egress_ip_type:Dedicated/Shared
      footprint : 12345
- Vpop is disabled
- Send traffic to not match the policy
- Check that the policy is not matched, and ensure that the corresponding IPs are not used
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- DEIP policy is not matched
- DE/VPOP IP is not used for traffic
- Review appmodule 3 logs to see so_mark not picked 
- Review policy 1 logs, to see EgressIP policy not being picked

updated_cases.title: Verify sending traffic to match 2 DEIP policy with different app and footprint
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create tenant_footprint.json with two footprint both enabled
- Create DEIP policy with 
   User:testuser-2@netskope.com
   App:Office
   "egress_ip_type": dedicated, footprint-1
- Create DEIP policy with 
   User:testuser-2@netskope.com
   App:Box
   "egress_ip_type": dedicated, footprint-2
- Send traffic to match both DEIP policy
- Check that the corresponding IPs are used while sending traffic
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- DEIP policy is matched
- DEIP is used for traffic
- Review appmodule 3 logs to see so_mark picked 
- Review policy 1 logs, to see EgressIP policy being picked indicated by ns_policy_apply_egress_ip_policy()

updated_cases.title: Verify sending traffic to match 2 DEIP policy with different user group and footprint
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create tenant_footprint.json with two footprint both enabled
- Create DEIP policy with 
   UserGroup:test-group1
   App:Office
   "egress_ip_type": dedicated, footprint-1
- Create DEIP policy with 
   UserGroup:test-group2
   App:Box
   "egress_ip_type": dedicated, footprint-2
- Send traffic to match both DEIP policy
- Check that the corresponding IPs are used while sending traffic
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- DEIP policy is matched
- DEIP is used for traffic
- Review appmodule 3 logs to see so_mark picked 
- Review policy 1 logs, to see EgressIP policy being picked indicated by ns_policy_apply_egress_ip_policy()
